events.title: a group of stranded settlers resort to eating human flesh

movie.title: The Donner Party
movie.plot: Based on the real events of The Donner Party tragedy. The Donner Party was a group of California-bound American settlers caught up in the western expansion of the 1840s. After becoming snowbound in the Sierra Nevada during the winter of 1846-1847, a number of the trapped settlers joined together in a final effort to reach California and organize a rescue party.

events.title: Ian Hamilton is caught trying to break into Westminster Abbey

movie.title: Stone of Destiny
movie.plot: Tells of the daring heist of The Stone of Destiny in the 1950s by a charming group of idealistic Scottish undergraduates, whose action rekindled Scottish nationalistic pride.

events.title: Karla Homolka and Paul Bernardo assault Karla's sister

movie.title: Karla
movie.plot: Based on real events, Canada's most notorious serial killers, Paul Bernardo and wife Karla Homolka kidnap, sexually abuse, and murder three young girls.

events.title: a settlement is reached between the mine and its sexually harassed employees

movie.title: North Country
movie.plot: A fictionalized account of the first major successful sexual harassment case in the United States -- Jenson vs. Eveleth Mines, where a woman who endured a range of abuse while working as a miner filed and won the landmark 1984 lawsuit.
movie.awards: Nominated for 2 Oscars. Another 6 wins & 17 nominations.

events.title: Kevin is left at home alone

movie.title: Home Alone
movie.plot: Eight-year-old Kevin McCallister makes the most of the situation after his family unwittingly leaves him behind when they go on Christmas vacation. But when a pair of bungling burglars set their sights on Kevin's house, the plucky kid stands ready to defend his territory. By planting booby traps galore, adorably mischievous Kevin stands his ground as his frantic mother attempts to race home before Christmas Day.
movie.awards: Nominated for 2 Oscars. Another 11 wins & 4 nominations.
